intro: Ornithogalum etesiogaripense subsp. longipilosum, commonly known as the long-hairy star-of-Bethlehem, is a member of the Asparagaceae family. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of white, star-shaped flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it grows in rocky or sandy soils. This plant is often found in open habitats and is adapted to arid or semi-arid conditions.
